conclusion: To solve the problem of finding the work done externally by the gas from state A to state B, we need to follow these steps.
The process from point A to point B is a constant pressure process (isobaric process).
Pressure remains constant throughout the segment from A to B.
Point A has a volume \(V_A = 3 \text{ L}\) and Point B has a volume \(V_B = 4 \text{ L}\).
The change in volume \(\Delta V\) is \(1 \text{ L}\).
The work done during an isobaric process can be calculated using \(W = p \cdot \Delta V\).
Substitute values into the formula to find \(W = 1 \times 10^5 \text{ J}\).
The work done externally by the gas is the negative of the work done on the gas.
The work done externally by the gas from state A to state B is \(-1 \times 10^5 \text{ J}\).
